Header_Description: Frontend Engineer specializing in building scalable React.js applications and maintainable UI systems.

Projects.Title: UST Portfolio Market Risk VaR Calculator
Projects.OnelineDescription: A robust tool for calculating Value at Risk (VaR) for an UST (United States Treasury) Portfolio, employing a C# thick client GUI with a Python FastAPI
Projects.BriefDescription: A robust tool for calculating Value at Risk (VaR) for an UST (United States Treasury) Portfolio, employing a C# thick client GUI with a Python FastAPI server backend and SQL Server database. This application helps investors analyze and optimize their portfolio's market risk.

Overview.Description: The application is designed to allow users to construct a portfolio of US Treasury securities and analyze its market risk using Value at Risk (VaR) calculations. The following UST data is downloaded from the US Treasury portal: 4-Week, 8-Week, 13-Week, 26-Week, and 52-Week securities.

Users can define a fixed income portfolio by assigning weights to these different securities, ensuring the sum of the weights equals 1.0. The C# GUI then instructs the Python API server to calculate VaR for this portfolio using two methods:

Overview.name: Historical Simulation:
Overview.Description: A non-parametric approach using historical price data.

Overview.name: Parametric Method:
Overview.Description: A statistical approach assuming a normal distribution of returns.

KeyFeatures.Name: C# Thick Client GUI
KeyFeatures.Description: User-friendly interface for easy portfolio construction, data input, and result visualization.

KeyFeatures.Name: Python FastAPI Backend:
KeyFeatures.Description: High-performance API for serving VaR calculations and data retrieval.

KeyFeatures.Name: SQL Server Database:
KeyFeatures.Description: Secure and scalable data storage for instrument data, portfolio information, and historical market data.

KeyFeatures.Name: Comprehensive VaR Calculations:
KeyFeatures.Description: Supports Historical Simulation and Parametric VaR methodologies with adjustable confidence levels.

Challenges&Learnings.Name: Cross-Platform Integration:
Challenges&Learnings.Description: Integrating C# GUI with Python backend required efficient data serialization and API design.

Challenges&Learnings.Name: Performance Optimization:
Challenges&Learnings.Description: Optimizing Python code for efficient VaR calculations to provide near-real-time results.

Challenges&Learnings.Name: Data Handling:
Challenges&Learnings.Description: Designing a robust database schema in SQL Server to store and retrieve large amounts of historical market data.

Challenges&Learnings.Name: User Interface:
Challenges&Learnings.Description: Building a user-friendly C# interface for interacting with the VaR calculator and visualizing results.

Descriptions.DescriptionPara: I’m a Frontend Engineer with 6 years of IT experience and 4+ years working with React.js, focused on building scalable, maintainable user interfaces. I enjoy working with component-driven architecture, state management, and clean UI systems while integrating REST APIs in real-world applications.

Currently at Tata Consultancy Services, I work on enterprise-scale React applications and complex legacy codebases. I’m also expanding into the MERN stack through personal projects, aiming to grow as a product-focused engineer who builds reliable and scalable solutions.
